jobs.title: Personal Assistant to Director
jobs.description:
Minimum 2 years’ experience within the corporate market.

Key Responsibilities:

• Ensuring good diary management and timely organisation of meetings
• Making travel and accommodation arrangements and managing expenses using corporate systems
• Meeting support - including agenda preparation and communication, meeting notes as required
• Creating and maintaining effective working relationships with both internal and external contacts
• Developing a keen understanding of the priorities for the leaders you support as well as the business/functional areas they work in
• Ensuring the safe keeping of confidential information, displaying discretion when dealing with matters of confidence and ensuring confidential documents are distributed, stored and destroyed effectively
• Provides support for other PAs in their absence
• Organise and prioritise large volumes of information
• Proactively read, sort, distribute, respond to incoming emails. Drafts written responses or replies by phone or email when necessary. Responds to regularly occurring requests for information
• Filter emails, making independent decisions on issues that need addressing and actioning directly or delegating the matter
• Occasionally required to work outside of office hours


Skills & Experience Required:

• You are a native French speaker
• Have proven experience in administration, file preparation and diary management
• Legal knowledge is a plus
• Excellent communication skills, at all levels, both written and verbal in French and English
• Confident, independent, strong problem-solving skills and a can do attitude
• Demonstrate a high level of discretion and confidentiality
• Super-organised with high attention to detail 
• Hardworking, self-motivated and able to think on your feet
• Work well in a team with a flexible and positive approach to work
• Excellent Microsoft Office and Outlook skills

IN RETURN
• Competitive and negotiable salary
• Travel allowance
• Medical and dental insurance
• 30 holidays + bank holidays
• Team building events

jobs.title: Personal Assistant to Director
jobs.description:
Alpha Blue Ocean is a sector agnostic alternative investment firm operating across the world. Our office is based in London, Mayfair.
As a PA, your primary role is to provide a first-class confidential secretarial and administrative support to the Director.

Minimum 2 years’ experience within the corporate market.

Key Responsibilities
• Ensuring good diary management and timely organisation of meetings
• Making travel and accommodation arrangements and managing expenses using corporate systems
• Meeting support - including agenda preparation and communication, meeting notes as required
• Creating and maintaining effective working relationships with both internal and external contacts
• Developing a keen understanding of the priorities for the leaders you support as well as the business/functional areas they work in
• Ensuring the safe keeping of confidential information, displaying discretion when dealing with matters of confidence and ensuring confidential documents are distributed, stored and destroyed effectively
• Provides support for other PAs in their absence
• Organise and prioritise large volumes of information
• Proactively read, sort, distribute, respond to incoming emails. Drafts written responses or replies by phone or email when necessary. Responds to regularly occurring requests for information
• Filter emails, making independent decisions on issues that need addressing and actioning directly or delegating the matter
• Occasionally required to work outside of office hours


Skills & Experience Required:
• You are a native French speaker
• Have proven experience in administration, file preparation and diary management
• Legal knowledge is a plus
• Excellent communication skills, at all levels, both written and verbal in French and English
• Confident, independent, strong problem-solving skills and a can do attitude
• Demonstrate a high level of discretion and confidentiality
• Super-organised with high attention to detail 
• Hardworking, self-motivated and able to think on your feet
• Work well in a team with a flexible and positive approach to work
• Excellent Microsoft Office and Outlook skills

IN RETURN
• Competitive and negotiable salary
• Travel allowance
• Medical and dental insurance
• 30 holidays + bank holidays
• Team building events
